title: Creamy Pesto Penne with Sausage
description: Quick weeknight dinner. Ready in 15 minutes!
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook pasta according to package directions until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup pasta water, then drain.
While pasta cooks, heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add sausage and cook 5–7 minutes, breaking it apart until browned and cooked through.
In a small saucepan, whisk together the pesto mix, milk, and olive oil. Bring to a gentle simmer, stirring frequently, until slightly thickened (about 3 minutes).
Add the cooked sausage and drained pasta into the skillet. Pour in the sauce and toss to coat evenly. Add reserved pasta water as needed for creaminess.
Season with salt and pepper. Serve topped with parmesan.

title: Chicken Alfredo
description: Classic creamy Alfredo tossed with tender chicken.
ingredients: 1 lb chicken breast, sliced into strips
instructions: Cook fettuccine in salted boiling water until al dente. Reserve 1/4 cup of pasta water.
Season chicken with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat and sauté chicken 6–8 minutes until golden and cooked through. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, melt butter. Add garlic and cook 30–45 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in heavy cream and bring to a gentle simmer. Cook 3–4 minutes, stirring often, until slightly thickened.
Add in parmesan cheese and stir until the sauce becomes smooth and creamy. If too thick, thin with reserved pasta water.
Return chicken to the pan. Add cooked pasta and gently toss to coat.
Serve hot, topped with parsley.

title: Honey Garlic Chicken
description: Sweet, savory, sticky chicken perfect over rice.
instructions: Pat chicken dry and season lightly with salt and pepper.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Sear chicken 5–6 minutes per side until golden and cooked through.
In a small bowl, mix honey, soy sauce, and garlic. Pour mixture into the skillet and reduce heat to medium.
Whisk cornstarch with water, then stir into the sauce. Simmer 2–3 minutes until the sauce becomes sticky and coats the chicken.
Slice chicken and spoon extra sauce over the top. Garnish with green onion and serve with rice.

title: Easy Beef Tacos
description: Simple, fast tacos perfect for busy nights.
instructions: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Add ground beef and cook 6–7 minutes, breaking it apart until browned. Drain excess fat.
Add taco seasoning and water. Stir and simmer 3–4 minutes until thickened.
Warm taco shells in the oven for 2–3 minutes for extra crunch.
Fill shells with beef, lettuce, cheese, salsa, and any additional toppings.

title: Chicken & Veggie Stir Fry
description: A healthy stir fry with a simple homemade sauce.
ingredients: 2 cups mixed vegetables (broccoli, carrots, peppers, snap peas)
instructions: Heat oil in a large skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook 5–6 minutes until lightly browned and cooked through.
Add vegetables and stir fry 4–5 minutes until crisp-tender.
In a bowl, whisk soy sauce, honey, cornstarch, and water.
Pour sauce into skillet. Stir continuously for 1–2 minutes until the sauce thickens and coats the chicken and vegetables.
Finish with sesame oil if desired. Serve immediately over rice or noodles.

title: Classic Smashburgers
description: Crispy-edged burgers made on a hot skillet.
instructions: Divide beef into 4 loose balls without packing tightly.
Preheat a cast-iron skillet over high heat until extremely hot.
Place 1 beef ball onto the skillet and immediately smash it flat using a spatula or burger press. Season with salt and pepper.
Cook 1–2 minutes until edges become crispy. Flip, top with cheese, and cook another minute.
Toast buns in butter until golden. Assemble burgers with patties and pickles.

title: BBQ Chicken Pizza
description: Sweet BBQ sauce with chicken, red onion, and mozzarella.
instructions: Preheat oven to 425°F.
Spread BBQ sauce evenly over the crust.
Top with shredded chicken, red onion slices, and mozzarella cheese.
Bake 12–15 minutes until cheese is melted and edges are golden.
Garnish with cilantro if desired.

title: Garlic Butter Shrimp
description: Rich garlic butter shrimp ready in under 10 minutes.
instructions: Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add shrimp in a single layer. Season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes if using.
Cook 1–2 minutes per side until shrimp turn pink.
Stir in lemon juice and cook 30 more seconds. Serve immediately over rice or pasta.

title: Hearty Beef Chili
description: Simple, flavorful chili perfect for cold nights.
instructions: Heat a large pot over medium-high heat. Add beef and onion, cooking 6–8 minutes until beef is browned.
Stir in tomato paste and cook 1 minute.
Add kidney beans, diced tomatoes, chili seasoning, and beef broth.
Bring to a simmer and cook 20–30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thick and flavorful.
Serve with cheese, sour cream, or crackers.

title: Classic French Toast
description: Golden, fluffy French toast with cinnamon.
instructions: In a shallow bowl, whisk eggs, milk, cinnamon, and vanilla until smooth.
Dip each bread slice into the mixture, allowing it to soak for a few seconds per side.
Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat. Cook each slice 2–3 minutes per side until golden brown.
Serve warm with maple syrup.
